alert.note: Alert for Dade (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 30 at 7:49AM EST until December 30 at 3:10PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia...Tennessee... Lookout Creek near New England affecting Dade and Hamilton Counties. For the Lookout Creek...including New England, Flintstone...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and is forecast to continue for the next few hours. * WHERE...Lookout Creek near New England. * WHEN...Until late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 13 feet, Minor flooding expands along Sells Lane in Trenton...Mason Road near Rising Fawn...and Creek Road near New England. All these roads will be closed. Also minor flooding expands much further downstream as the creek crosses the Tennessee border into the Tiftonia area. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 AM EST Thursday the stage was 12.8 feet and falling. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:00 AM EST Thursday was 13.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this morning and continue falling to 8.6 feet late this afternoon. - Flood stage is 12 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta.
